                        <h3>Restaurant Services</h3>

                <main class="main-content">
                    <article>
                        <h2>Accounting Built for Restaurants</h2>
                        <p>Running a restaurant is challenging enough without worrying about complex accounting. From managing food costs and inventory to tracking tips and labor percentages, restaurant accounting requires specialized knowledge. Phenom provides comprehensive accounting services designed specifically for the food service and hospitality industry.</p>

                        <h3 id="cogs"> Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) Management</h3>
                        <p>Control your food and beverage costs:</p>
                        
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-utensils"></i>
                                <h4>Food Cost Tracking</h4>
                                <p>Monitor food costs as % of sales (target: 28-35%)</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-wine-glass"></i>
                                <h4>Beverage Cost</h4>
                                <p>Track alcohol and non-alcoholic beverage costs</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-calculator"></i>
                                <h4>Recipe Costing</h4>
                                <p>Calculate theoretical food cost by menu item</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Variance Analysis</h4>
                                <p>Actual vs. theoretical cost comparison</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>COGS Components</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Beginning Inventory:</strong> Opening inventory value</li>
                            <li><strong>Purchases:</strong> Food, beverage, supplies purchased during period</li>
                            <li><strong>Ending Inventory:</strong> Closing inventory value (physical count)</li>
                            <li><strong>Formula:</strong> Beginning Inventory + Purchases - Ending Inventory = COGS</li>
                            <li><strong>Prime Cost:</strong> COGS + Labor (target: 60-65% of sales)</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Food Cost Categories</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Proteins:</strong> Meat, poultry, seafood</li>
                            <li><strong>Produce:</strong> Fresh fruits and vegetables</li>
                            <li><strong>Dry Goods:</strong> Flour, rice, pasta, canned items</li>
                            <li><strong>Dairy:</strong> Milk, cheese, butter, eggs</li>
                            <li><strong>Beverages:</strong> Coffee, soft drinks, juices</li>
                            <li><strong>Alcohol:</strong> Beer, wine, spirits</li>
                            <li><strong>Paper/Disposables:</strong> Takeout containers, napkins</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="inventory"> Inventory Management</h3>
                        <p>Track inventory to control costs and reduce waste:</p>

                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clipboard-list"></i>
                                <h4>Physical Counts</h4>
                                <p>Weekly or monthly inventory counts</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-boxes"></i>
                                <h4>Par Levels</h4>
                                <p>Set minimum stock levels for ordering</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-trash-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Waste Tracking</h4>
                                <p>Monitor spoilage and portion waste</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-sync-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Turnover Ratio</h4>
                                <p>How quickly inventory is used</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Inventory Best Practices</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Count Weekly:</strong> High-value items (proteins, alcohol)</li>
                            <li><strong>Count Monthly:</strong> All inventory items</li>
                            <li><strong>FIFO Method:</strong> First In, First Out for perishables</li>
                            <li><strong>Vendor Reconciliation:</strong> Match invoices to deliveries</li>
                            <li><strong>Theft Prevention:</strong> Track variances and shrinkage</li>
                            <li><strong>Portion Control:</strong> Standard recipes and portions</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="labor"> Labor Cost Management</h3>
                        <p>Control your largest expense after COGS:</p>

                        <h4>Labor Cost Breakdown</h4>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Labor Cost %</h4>
                                <p>Target: 25-35% of sales</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-users"></i>
                                <h4>FOH vs BOH</h4>
                                <p>Front of house vs. back of house split</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clock"></i>
                                <h4>Hourly Analysis</h4>
                                <p>Sales per labor hour tracking</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-calendar-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Scheduling</h4>
                                <p>Optimize staffing based on sales forecasts</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Labor Categories</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Management:</strong> General manager, assistant managers</li>
                            <li><strong>Kitchen Staff:</strong> Chefs, line cooks, prep cooks, dishwashers</li>
                            <li><strong>Front of House:</strong> Servers, bartenders, hosts, bussers</li>
                            <li><strong>Delivery Drivers:</strong> (if applicable)</li>
                            <li><strong>Overtime:</strong> Time and a half calculations</li>
                            <li><strong>Payroll Taxes:</strong> FICA, unemployment, workers' comp</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="tips"> Tip Tracking & Distribution</h3>
                        <p>Accurate tip reporting and distribution:</p>

                        <h4>Tip Types</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Cash Tips:</strong> Tips left in cash</li>
                            <li><strong>Credit Card Tips:</strong> Tips charged to cards</li>
                            <li><strong>Tip Pooling:</strong> Shared tips among staff</li>
                            <li><strong>Tip Out:</strong> Servers tipping bartenders, bussers</li>
                            <li><strong>Auto-Gratuity:</strong> Automatic gratuity for large parties</li>
                            <li><strong>Service Charges:</strong> Mandatory service fees (not tips)</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h4>Tip Compliance</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>IRS Reporting:</strong> Tips are taxable income (Form 4070)</li>
                            <li><strong>Tip Credit:</strong> Reduced minimum wage for tipped employees</li>
                            <li><strong>80/20 Rule:</strong> Tipped work vs. non-tipped work split</li>
                            <li><strong>FICA Tip Tax:</strong> Employer portion on reported tips</li>
                            <li><strong>Form 8027:</strong> Annual tip reporting for large restaurants</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="pos"> POS System Integration</h3>
                        <p>Seamless integration with restaurant POS systems:</p>

                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>Sales Data Import</h4>
                                <p>Automatic import of daily sales</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-receipt"></i>
                                <h4>Payment Type Split</h4>
                                <p>Cash, credit, gift cards, online orders</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-pie"></i>
                                <h4>Category Reporting</h4>
                                <p>Sales by food, beverage, alcohol</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-sync"></i>
                                <h4>Real-Time Sync</h4>
                                <p>Daily sales automatically recorded</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>POS Systems We Integrate With</h3>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-mobile-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Toast POS</h4>
                                <p>Popular cloud-based restaurant POS</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-mobile-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Square</h4>
                                <p>Square for Restaurants</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-mobile-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Clover</h4>
                                <p>Clover restaurant systems</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-mobile-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Lightspeed</h4>
                                <p>Restaurant & retail POS</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Revenue Streams</h2>
                        <p>Track all revenue sources separately:</p>

                        <h3>Dine-In Revenue</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Food Sales:</strong> Appetizers, entrees, desserts</li>
                            <li><strong>Beverage Sales:</strong> Soft drinks, coffee, tea</li>
                            <li><strong>Alcohol Sales:</strong> Beer, wine, cocktails</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Off-Premise Revenue</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Takeout:</strong> Phone orders, walk-in pickup</li>
                            <li><strong>Delivery:</strong> In-house or third-party delivery</li>
                            <li><strong>Catering:</strong> Off-site catering services</li>
                            <li><strong>Online Orders:</strong> Website or app orders</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Third-Party Delivery Platforms</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>DoorDash:</strong> Commission ~30%, track net revenue</li>
                            <li><strong>Uber Eats:</strong> Commission ~30%, track net revenue</li>
                            <li><strong>Grubhub:</strong> Commission ~30%, track net revenue</li>
                            <li><strong>Commission Expense:</strong> Record as marketing/commission expense</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)</h2>
                        <p>Essential metrics for restaurant success:</p>

                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Food Cost %</h4>
                                <p>COGS  Food Sales (Target: 28-35%)</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Labor Cost %</h4>
                                <p>Labor  Total Sales (Target: 25-35%)</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Prime Cost</h4>
                                <p>COGS + Labor (Target: 60-65%)</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-dollar-sign"></i>
                                <h4>Average Check</h4>
                                <p>Total Sales  Number of Guests</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-users"></i>
                                <h4>Covers per Labor Hour</h4>
                                <p>Guests served per labor hour</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chair"></i>
                                <h4>Table Turns</h4>
                                <p>Number of times each table is used</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Sales per Square Foot</h4>
                                <p>Revenue efficiency measure</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-utensils"></i>
                                <h4>Menu Item Mix</h4>
                                <p>Best-selling vs. high-margin items</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Multi-Location Restaurant Accounting</h2>
                        <p>For restaurant chains and franchises:</p>

                        <h3>Location-Level Reporting</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Individual P&L for each location</li>
                            <li>Consolidated financial statements</li>
                            <li>Comparison reports (location vs. location)</li>
                            <li>Regional performance analysis</li>
                            <li>Same-store sales growth</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Franchise Accounting</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Royalty Fees:</strong> % of sales paid to franchisor</li>
                            <li><strong>Marketing Fees:</strong> National advertising fund contributions</li>
                            <li><strong>Compliance:</strong> Follow franchisor accounting requirements</li>
                            <li><strong>Reporting:</strong> Regular reports to franchisor</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Expense Categories</h2>
                        <p>Typical restaurant operating expenses:</p>

                        <h3>Fixed Costs</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Rent/Mortgage:</strong> Facility costs (typically 6-10% of sales)</li>
                            <li><strong>Insurance:</strong> General liability, property, workers' comp</li>
                            <li><strong>Licenses & Permits:</strong> Health permits, liquor licenses</li>
                            <li><strong>Equipment Leases:</strong> POS, ovens, refrigeration</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Variable Costs</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Utilities:</strong> Gas, electric, water, trash (2-3% of sales)</li>
                            <li><strong>Repairs & Maintenance:</strong> Equipment repairs, facilities upkeep</li>
                            <li><strong>Marketing:</strong> Advertising, promotions, social media</li>
                            <li><strong>Supplies:</strong> Cleaning, smallwares, uniforms</li>
                            <li><strong>Credit Card Fees:</strong> 2-3% of card sales</li>
                            <li><strong>Delivery Commissions:</strong> Third-party delivery fees</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Tax Considerations</h2>
                        <p>Restaurant-specific tax issues:</p>

                        <h3>Sales Tax</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Food vs. Beverage:</strong> Different rates in some states</li>
                            <li><strong>To-Go Orders:</strong> May be tax-exempt in some states</li>
                            <li><strong>Alcohol Tax:</strong> Special excise taxes on alcohol</li>
                            <li><strong>Catering Tax:</strong> Different treatment for catered events</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Deductible Expenses</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Food and beverage costs (COGS)</li>
                            <li>Labor and payroll taxes</li>
                            <li>Rent, utilities, insurance</li>
                            <li>Equipment depreciation (Section 179)</li>
                            <li>Marketing and advertising</li>
                            <li>Repairs and maintenance</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Why Restaurants Choose Phenom</h2>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-utensils"></i>
                                <h4>Restaurant Expertise</h4>
                                <p>We understand food service operations</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Control Costs</h4>
                                <p>Monitor food and labor costs in real-time</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>POS Integration</h4>
                                <p>Seamless data flow from POS to accounting</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clock"></i>
                                <h4>Save Time</h4>
                                <p>Focus on guests, not bookkeeping</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Get Started</h2>
                        <p>Ready to gain better control over your restaurant's finances? Our hospitality accounting specialists understand the unique challenges of the food service industry and can help you improve profitability.</p>
                        
                        <div style="text-align: center; margin: 3rem 0;">
                            <button class="btn-large" onclick="openModal()">Talk to a Restaurant Accounting Expert</button>
                        </div>
                    </article>
                </main>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>

    <section class="page-cta">
        <div class="container">
            <h2>Keep Your Restaurant Profitable</h2>
            <p>Food Cost Control  Labor Management  Tip Tracking  Multi-Location Reporting</p>
            <button class="btn-large" onclick="openModal()">Get Started</button>

        // Load Header
        fetch('../../includes/header.html')
            .then(response => response.text())
            .then(data => {
                document.getElementById('header-placeholder').innerHTML = data;
                
                // Initialize after header loads
                setTimeout(() => {
                    if (typeof initMobileMenu === 'function') initMobileMenu();
                    if (typeof initStickyHeader === 'function') initStickyHeader();
                }, 100);
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Header error:', error));

        // Load Footer
        fetch('../../includes/footer.html')
            .then(response => response.text())
            .then(data => {
                document.getElementById('footer-placeholder').innerHTML = data;
            })
            .catch(error => console.error('Footer error:', error));
    </script>

                <main class="main-content">
                    <article>
                        <h2>Accounting Built for Real Estate</h2>
                        <p>Real estate has unique accounting challenges: tracking income and expenses by property, managing security deposits, depreciation calculations, 1031 exchange tracking, and complex tax reporting. Phenom provides specialized real estate accounting services.</p>

                        <h3 id="rental"> Rental Property Accounting</h3>
                        <p>Property-level tracking for landlords and investors:</p>
                        
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-building"></i>
                                <h4>Property-Level P&L</h4>
                                <p>Income and expenses by individual property</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-money-bill-wave"></i>
                                <h4>Rent Collection</h4>
                                <p>Track rent payments and late fees</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-shield-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Security Deposits</h4>
                                <p>Proper liability tracking for deposits</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-wrench"></i>
                                <h4>Maintenance Tracking</h4>
                                <p>CapEx vs. repairs classification</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Rental Income Types</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Base Rent:</strong> Monthly rent from tenants</li>
                            <li><strong>Late Fees:</strong> Penalties for late payment</li>
                            <li><strong>Pet Rent:</strong> Additional monthly pet fees</li>
                            <li><strong>Parking/Storage:</strong> Additional amenity income</li>
                            <li><strong>Application Fees:</strong> Non-refundable tenant screening fees</li>
                            <li><strong>Lease Break Fees:</strong> Early termination charges</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Operating Expenses by Property</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Mortgage:</strong> Principal and interest by property</li>
                            <li><strong>Property Tax:</strong> Real estate taxes</li>
                            <li><strong>Insurance:</strong> Property and liability insurance</li>
                            <li><strong>Utilities:</strong> Water, gas, electric (if landlord-paid)</li>
                            <li><strong>HOA Fees:</strong> Homeowner association dues</li>
                            <li><strong>Repairs & Maintenance:</strong> Ongoing upkeep</li>
                            <li><strong>Property Management:</strong> Management fees (typically 8-10%)</li>
                            <li><strong>Landscaping/Snow:</strong> Exterior maintenance</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="property-mgmt"> Property Management Accounting</h3>
                        <p>For property management companies:</p>

                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-users"></i>
                                <h4>Owner Statements</h4>
                                <p>Monthly statements for property owners</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-hand-holding-usd"></i>
                                <h4>Trust Accounting</h4>
                                <p>Separate accounting for tenant deposits</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percent"></i>
                                <h4>Management Fees</h4>
                                <p>Calculate fees as % of collected rent</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-file-invoice"></i>
                                <h4>Tenant Billing</h4>
                                <p>Generate tenant invoices and statements</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Property Management Services</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Rent Roll:</strong> Current tenant list with rent amounts and lease terms</li>
                            <li><strong>Vacancy Tracking:</strong> Days vacant and lost income</li>
                            <li><strong>Tenant Ledgers:</strong> Individual account for each tenant</li>
                            <li><strong>Work Orders:</strong> Track maintenance requests and costs</li>
                            <li><strong>Vendor Management:</strong> Track contractor payments</li>
                            <li><strong>Owner Distributions:</strong> Calculate and pay owner proceeds</li>
                            <li><strong>Reserves:</strong> Capital reserve tracking</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="1031"> 1031 Exchange Tracking</h3>
                        <p>Like-kind exchange accounting support:</p>

                        <h4>1031 Exchange Process</h4>
                        <ol style="line-height: 2;">
                            <li><strong>Relinquished Property:</strong> Track sale of old property</li>
                            <li><strong>45-Day Identification:</strong> Document potential replacement properties</li>
                            <li><strong>180-Day Purchase:</strong> Track acquisition of replacement property</li>
                            <li><strong>Qualified Intermediary:</strong> Track funds held in escrow</li>
                            <li><strong>Basis Carryover:</strong> Calculate new property basis</li>
                            <li><strong>Boot Tracking:</strong> Identify and calculate taxable boot</li>
                        </ol>

                        <h4>Tax Reporting</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Form 8824 (Like-Kind Exchange) preparation</li>
                            <li>Adjusted basis calculations</li>
                            <li>Depreciation recapture analysis</li>
                            <li>Boot recognition (cash or debt relief)</li>
                            <li>Related party transaction compliance</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Depreciation & Cost Segregation</h3>
                        <p>Maximize tax benefits through proper depreciation:</p>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-home"></i>
                                <h4>Building Depreciation</h4>
                                <p>27.5 years (residential) or 39 years (commercial)</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-layer-group"></i>
                                <h4>Cost Segregation</h4>
                                <p>Accelerate depreciation on components</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-tools"></i>
                                <h4>Improvements</h4>
                                <p>CapEx vs. repairs determination</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-bolt"></i>
                                <h4>Bonus Depreciation</h4>
                                <p>100% bonus on qualified property</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3 id="development"> Real Estate Development</h3>
                        <p>Accounting for development projects:</p>

                        <h4>Development Cost Tracking</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Land Acquisition:</strong> Purchase price and closing costs</li>
                            <li><strong>Hard Costs:</strong> Construction, materials, labor</li>
                            <li><strong>Soft Costs:</strong> Permits, fees, design, legal</li>
                            <li><strong>Financing Costs:</strong> Construction loan interest</li>
                            <li><strong>Overhead Allocation:</strong> Developer overhead</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h4>Project Accounting</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Job cost tracking by development project</li>
                            <li>Draw schedule management</li>
                            <li>Lender reporting and compliance</li>
                            <li>Budget vs. actual analysis</li>
                            <li>Completion percentage (for builders)</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="agents"> Real Estate Agent & Broker Accounting</h3>
                        <p>For real estate professionals:</p>

                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-hand-holding-usd"></i>
                                <h4>Commission Tracking</h4>
                                <p>Track commissions by transaction</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Splits & Referrals</h4>
                                <p>Calculate broker splits and referral fees</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-car"></i>
                                <h4>Mileage Tracking</h4>
                                <p>Deductible mileage for showings</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clipboard-list"></i>
                                <h4>Schedule C</h4>
                                <p>Self-employed tax return preparation</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Agent/Broker Expenses</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>MLS Fees:</strong> Multiple Listing Service dues</li>
                            <li><strong>Board Dues:</strong> Realtor association memberships</li>
                            <li><strong>E&O Insurance:</strong> Errors and omissions coverage</li>
                            <li><strong>Marketing:</strong> Advertising, signs, photography</li>
                            <li><strong>Continuing Education:</strong> License renewal courses</li>
                            <li><strong>Transaction Fees:</strong> Per-deal brokerage fees</li>
                            <li><strong>Home Office:</strong> Deductible office space</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Tax Strategies for Real Estate</h2>
                        <p>Maximize deductions and minimize taxes:</p>

                        <h3>Schedule E Optimization</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Rental income and expense reporting</li>
                            <li>Passive loss limitations and carryforwards</li>
                            <li>Real estate professional status election</li>
                            <li>Material participation tracking</li>
                            <li>QBI (Qualified Business Income) deduction</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Entity Structure Planning</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Personal Ownership:</strong> Schedule E reporting</li>
                            <li><strong>LLC (Disregarded):</strong> Same as personal but liability protection</li>
                            <li><strong>LLC (Partnership):</strong> Multiple owners, K-1 distributions</li>
                            <li><strong>S-Corporation:</strong> Active real estate business</li>
                            <li><strong>C-Corporation:</strong> Development companies</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Financial Reports for Real Estate</h2>
                        <p>Essential reports for property owners:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Property P&L:</strong> Income and expenses by property</li>
                            <li><strong>Portfolio Summary:</strong> All properties consolidated</li>
                            <li><strong>Cash Flow Analysis:</strong> Operating cash flow vs. debt service</li>
                            <li><strong>Rent Roll:</strong> Tenant list with lease terms</li>
                            <li><strong>Vacancy Report:</strong> Occupancy rates and trends</li>
                            <li><strong>Capital Reserve:</strong> Reserve fund balance</li>
                            <li><strong>Owner Distribution:</strong> Cash available for distribution</li>
                            <li><strong>Tax Projection:</strong> Estimated tax liability</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Key Performance Metrics</h2>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Occupancy Rate</h4>
                                <p>Percentage of units occupied</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Cap Rate</h4>
                                <p>NOI divided by property value</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-money-bill-wave"></i>
                                <h4>Cash-on-Cash Return</h4>
                                <p>Annual cash flow / cash invested</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-calculator"></i>
                                <h4>Debt Service Coverage</h4>
                                <p>NOI / mortgage payments</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Software Integration</h2>
                        <p>We work with popular real estate software:</p>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>Buildium</h4>

                            </div>

                            </div>

                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>Rent Manager</h4>
                                <p>Commercial property management</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Why Real Estate Investors Choose Phenom</h2>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-home"></i>
                                <h4>Real Estate Expertise</h4>
                                <p>We understand property accounting</p>
                            </div>

                                <p>Focus on deals, not bookkeeping</p>
                            </div>

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Manufacturing & Distribution Accounting - Phenom</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Specialized accounting for manufacturers and distributors. Inventory costing, WIP tracking, cost accounting, standard costing, overhead allocation.">
    
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/style.css">
     <!-- FavIcon  -->
    <link rel="icon" href="Logo1.jpeg" type="image/x-icon">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/assets/css/pages.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.4.0/css/all.min.css">

                <a href="#">Industries</a>

                <span class="current">Manufacturing</span>

        </div>
    </section>

    <section class="page-hero">
        <div class="container">
            <h1> Manufacturing & Distribution Accounting</h1>
            <p class="lead">Specialized accounting for manufacturers, distributors, and wholesale businesses</p>
        </div>
    </section>

    <section class="page-content">
        <div class="container">
            <div class="content-layout">
                <aside class="sidebar">
                    <div class="sidebar-widget">
                        <h3>Manufacturing Services</h3>
                        <ul class="sidebar-menu">
                            <li><a href="#inventory">Inventory Costing</a></li>
                            <li><a href="#wip">WIP Tracking</a></li>
                            <li><a href="#cost">Cost Accounting</a></li>
                            <li><a href="#standard">Standard Costing</a></li>
                            <li><a href="#overhead">Overhead Allocation</a></li>
                        </ul>
                    </div>
                    
                    <div class="sidebar-widget cta-widget">
                        <h3>Manufacturing Expert</h3>
                        <p>Talk to our manufacturing specialist</p>
                        <button class="btn-primary" onclick="openModal()">Get Started</button>
                    </div>
                </aside>

                <main class="main-content">
                    <article>
                        <h2>Accounting Built for Manufacturing</h2>
                        <p>Manufacturing accounting is complex, involving raw materials, work-in-progress, finished goods, bill of materials, production costing, and overhead allocation. Whether you're a discrete manufacturer, process manufacturer, or wholesale distributor, Phenom provides specialized accounting services designed for your industry.</p>

                        <h3 id="inventory"> Inventory Costing & Valuation</h3>
                        <p>Comprehensive inventory management and costing:</p>
                        
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-boxes"></i>
                                <h4>3-Tier Inventory</h4>
                                <p>Raw materials, WIP, finished goods tracking</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-calculator"></i>
                                <h4>Costing Methods</h4>
                                <p>FIFO, LIFO, Weighted Average, Standard Cost</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Inventory Valuation</h4>
                                <p>Accurate balance sheet valuation</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-sync-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Turnover Analysis</h4>
                                <p>Inventory turnover ratio and aging</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Inventory Categories</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Raw Materials:</strong> Components and materials to be used in production</li>
                            <li><strong>Work in Progress (WIP):</strong> Partially completed products in production</li>
                            <li><strong>Finished Goods:</strong> Completed products ready for sale</li>
                            <li><strong>Supplies & Consumables:</strong> Manufacturing supplies, packaging materials</li>
                            <li><strong>Obsolete Inventory:</strong> Slow-moving or obsolete items reserves</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Inventory Costing Methods</h3>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-arrow-right"></i>
                                <h4>FIFO</h4>
                                <p>First In, First Out - oldest costs used first</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-arrow-left"></i>
                                <h4>LIFO</h4>
                                <p>Last In, First Out - newest costs used first</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-balance-scale"></i>
                                <h4>Weighted Average</h4>
                                <p>Average cost of all units available</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-cogs"></i>
                                <h4>Standard Cost</h4>
                                <p>Predetermined costs with variance analysis</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3 id="wip"> Work in Progress (WIP) Tracking</h3>
                        <p>Monitor production floor inventory:</p>

                        <h4>WIP Components</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Direct Materials:</strong> Raw materials issued to production</li>
                            <li><strong>Direct Labor:</strong> Labor hours applied to production</li>
                            <li><strong>Manufacturing Overhead:</strong> Allocated overhead costs</li>
                            <li><strong>Production Orders:</strong> Track costs by production job/batch</li>
                            <li><strong>Completion Status:</strong> % complete for long production runs</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h4>WIP Accounting</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Beginning WIP balance</li>
                            <li>Materials issued to production (debits to WIP)</li>
                            <li>Direct labor applied (debits to WIP)</li>
                            <li>Manufacturing overhead applied (debits to WIP)</li>
                            <li>Goods completed (credits to WIP, debits to Finished Goods)</li>
                            <li>Ending WIP balance</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="cost"> Cost of Goods Manufactured (COGM)</h3>
                        <p>Calculate the true cost of production:</p>

                        <h4>COGM Formula</h4>
                        <div style="background: var(--bg-light); padding: 2rem; border-radius: 0.5rem; margin: 2rem 0;">
                            <pre style="font-family: monospace; line-height: 1.8;">
Beginning WIP
+ Direct Materials Used
+ Direct Labor
+ Manufacturing Overhead Applied
- Ending WIP
= Cost of Goods Manufactured
                            </pre>
                        </div>

                        <h4>Direct Materials Used</h4>
                        <pre style="background: var(--bg-light); padding: 1.5rem; border-radius: 0.5rem; font-family: monospace; line-height: 1.8;">
Beginning Raw Materials
+ Purchases
- Ending Raw Materials
= Direct Materials Used
                        </pre>

                        <h3>Cost Components</h3>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-box"></i>
                                <h4>Direct Materials</h4>
                                <p>Raw materials directly traceable to products</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-users"></i>
                                <h4>Direct Labor</h4>
                                <p>Production labor directly traceable to products</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-industry"></i>
                                <h4>Manufacturing Overhead</h4>
                                <p>Indirect costs allocated to production</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-pie"></i>
                                <h4>Period Costs</h4>
                                <p>Sales, admin, not included in product cost</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3 id="standard"> Standard Costing & Variance Analysis</h3>
                        <p>Set standard costs and analyze variances:</p>

                        <h4>Standard Cost Components</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Standard Material Cost:</strong> Expected cost per unit of material</li>
                            <li><strong>Standard Labor Cost:</strong> Expected labor hours  rate per product</li>
                            <li><strong>Standard Overhead Rate:</strong> Predetermined overhead application rate</li>
                            <li><strong>Standard Product Cost:</strong> Total expected cost per unit produced</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h4>Variance Analysis</h4>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-box-open"></i>
                                <h4>Material Variances</h4>
                                <p>Price variance & usage/quantity variance</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clock"></i>
                                <h4>Labor Variances</h4>
                                <p>Rate variance & efficiency variance</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-cogs"></i>
                                <h4>Overhead Variances</h4>
                                <p>Spending, efficiency, volume variances</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Variance Reporting</h4>
                                <p>Monthly variance analysis and explanations</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h3>Variance Formulas</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Material Price Variance:</strong> (Actual Price - Standard Price)  Actual Quantity</li>
                            <li><strong>Material Quantity Variance:</strong> (Actual Quantity - Standard Quantity)  Standard Price</li>
                            <li><strong>Labor Rate Variance:</strong> (Actual Rate - Standard Rate)  Actual Hours</li>
                            <li><strong>Labor Efficiency Variance:</strong> (Actual Hours - Standard Hours)  Standard Rate</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3 id="overhead"> Manufacturing Overhead Allocation</h3>
                        <p>Allocate indirect costs to products:</p>

                        <h4>Overhead Cost Pool</h4>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Indirect Materials:</strong> Shop supplies, lubricants, small tools</li>
                            <li><strong>Indirect Labor:</strong> Supervisors, QC, maintenance staff</li>
                            <li><strong>Factory Rent/Depreciation:</strong> Building and equipment costs</li>
                            <li><strong>Utilities:</strong> Factory electricity, water, gas</li>
                            <li><strong>Repairs & Maintenance:</strong> Equipment repairs</li>
                            <li><strong>Insurance & Property Tax:</strong> Factory insurance and taxes</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h4>Allocation Bases</h4>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clock"></i>
                                <h4>Direct Labor Hours</h4>
                                <p>Most common allocation base</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-cog"></i>
                                <h4>Machine Hours</h4>
                                <p>For automated production</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-boxes"></i>
                                <h4>Units Produced</h4>
                                <p>Simple, single-product companies</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-dollar-sign"></i>
                                <h4>Direct Labor Cost</h4>
                                <p>Percentage of labor dollars</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h4>Overhead Rate Calculation</h4>
                        <pre style="background: var(--bg-light); padding: 1.5rem; border-radius: 0.5rem; font-family: monospace; line-height: 1.8;">
Predetermined Overhead Rate = 
    Estimated Total Overhead Costs
     Estimated Allocation Base

Applied Overhead = 
    Predetermined Rate  Actual Activity
                        </pre>

                        <h2>Bill of Materials (BOM) Management</h2>
                        <p>Track components required for each product:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Multi-Level BOM:</strong> Assemblies and sub-assemblies</li>
                            <li><strong>Component Costs:</strong> Track cost per component</li>
                            <li><strong>BOM Explosions:</strong> Calculate material requirements</li>
                            <li><strong>BOM Maintenance:</strong> Update for engineering changes</li>
                            <li><strong>Yield Tracking:</strong> Actual vs. expected material usage</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Production Order Costing</h2>
                        <p>Track costs by production job or batch:</p>

                        <h3>Job Order Costing</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Used for custom/discrete manufacturing</li>
                            <li>Separate cost sheet for each production job</li>
                            <li>Direct materials, labor, overhead by job</li>
                            <li>Suitable for job shops, custom products</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h3>Process Costing</h3>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Used for continuous/process manufacturing</li>
                            <li>Average cost per unit in each department</li>
                            <li>Equivalent units calculation for WIP</li>
                            <li>Suitable for chemicals, food processing, textiles</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Financial Reports for Manufacturing</h2>
                        <p>Essential reports for manufacturers:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>Cost of Goods Manufactured Statement:</strong> Detailed COGM calculation</li>
                            <li><strong>Inventory Valuation Report:</strong> Balance sheet inventory value by category</li>
                            <li><strong>Production Cost Report:</strong> Costs by product or department</li>
                            <li><strong>Variance Analysis Report:</strong> Standard vs. actual cost variances</li>
                            <li><strong>Overhead Analysis:</strong> Actual vs. applied overhead</li>
                            <li><strong>Inventory Turnover:</strong> Days in inventory by category</li>
                            <li><strong>WIP Aging:</strong> Age of work in progress</li>
                            <li><strong>Gross Margin by Product:</strong> Profitability by SKU</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Key Performance Indicators</h2>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-percentage"></i>
                                <h4>Gross Margin %</h4>
                                <p>(Sales - COGS)  Sales</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-sync-alt"></i>
                                <h4>Inventory Turnover</h4>
                                <p>COGS  Average Inventory</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-clock"></i>
                                <h4>Days in Inventory</h4>
                                <p>365  Inventory Turnover</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-cogs"></i>
                                <h4>Manufacturing Efficiency</h4>
                                <p>Standard Hours  Actual Hours</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Capacity Utilization</h4>
                                <p>Actual Production  Max Capacity</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-thumbs-up"></i>
                                <h4>First Pass Yield</h4>
                                <p>Good Units  Total Units Produced</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Software Integration</h2>
                        <p>We integrate with manufacturing ERP systems:</p>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>NetSuite</h4>
                                <p>Cloud manufacturing ERP</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>SAP Business One</h4>
                                <p>SMB manufacturing solution</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>Fishbowl</h4>
                                <p>Manufacturing & warehouse management</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-laptop"></i>
                                <h4>Katana</h4>
                                <p>Modern manufacturing software</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Compliance & Reporting</h2>
                        <p>Manufacturing-specific compliance:</p>
                        <ul>
                            <li><strong>GAAP Inventory Valuation:</strong> Lower of cost or market</li>
                            <li><strong>Obsolescence Reserves:</strong> Write-downs for obsolete inventory</li>
                            <li><strong>Capitalization Policy:</strong> Expense vs. capitalize production costs</li>
                            <li><strong>Overhead Absorption:</strong> Under/over-applied overhead treatment</li>
                            <li><strong>Transfer Pricing:</strong> Intercompany transfer pricing documentation</li>
                        </ul>

                        <h2>Why Manufacturers Choose Phenom</h2>
                        <div class="feature-grid">
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-industry"></i>
                                <h4>Manufacturing Expertise</h4>
                                <p>We understand production accounting</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i>
                                <h4>Cost Visibility</h4>
                                <p>Know true product costs and margins</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-boxes"></i>
                                <h4>Inventory Control</h4>
                                <p>Accurate inventory valuation and tracking</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="feature-item">
                                <i class="fa-solid fa-dollar-sign"></i>
                                <h4>Reduce Costs</h4>
                                <p>Variance analysis highlights cost savings opportunities</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>

                        <h2>Get Started</h2>
                        <p>Ready to gain better visibility into your manufacturing costs and improve profitability? Our manufacturing accounting specialists understand complex cost accounting and can help you optimize your operations.</p>
                        
                        <div style="text-align: center; margin: 3rem 0;">
                            <button class="btn-large" onclick="openModal()">Talk to a Manufacturing Accounting Expert</button>
                        </div>
